title: PCBs in Seals in a Food Web

content.question: A biologist is studying a small food web in which phytoplankton are eaten by krill, krill are eaten by fish, and fish are eaten by seals. During their study of the ecosystem, the biologist discovers that <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are present in measurable levels in the water and wants to examine how <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> could vary in different trophic levels. Which of the following best identifies a testable hypothesis for the study?

choices.label: Biomagnification will cause the phytoplankton outside the study area to have the highest amount of <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in their tissues.
Biomagnification will cause the seals to have the highest amount of <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in their tissues.

Bioaccumulation will cause the sealsÂ outside the study area to have the highest amount of <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in their tissues.
Bioaccumulation will cause the fish to have the highest amount of <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in their tissues.

content.answer: Biomagnification will cause the seals to have the highest amount of <math alttext="P C Bs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PCBs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in their tissues.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify a testable hypothesis or scientific question for an investigation.
